Recent updates from NYC include violent attacks on seniors, potential travel disruptions due to storms, and a $4 million settlement for a Rikers detainee. Additionally, the city is facing budget concerns, and new affordable housing projects are underway, while public safety and health insurance worries persist among residents.

### Risks & Alerts

- Seniors attacked in NYC, with reports of being shoved and punched; community urged to stay vigilant. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMinwFBVV95cUxNdGx5MUZ1MjhJb3B4NGVPSVc4LU5CNDZsNzljbWg1M3Exb1JvaWk4NVBNUHFtY1lsWk9MTXgtWlEwVGFranJOQkcza0w4Y3ZldTlpVmlWazhFeFl2RVF2X3lNU0lLYTlIdnFkckdzbndSUUkyQ2NrU2gwemh4ZHhVZ0FLcGlka2VjaU45aXJDcmE5Q2c0Z2NFbjFoZXNtMzQ?oc=5)
- Thanksgiving travel may be impacted by storms; residents should plan accordingly for potential delays. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Light rain and possible snow mix expected for Staten Island; residents should prepare for changing conditions. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
